trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Live Connect single sign-on in Azure Mobile Services from a Windows Store application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Live Connect single sign-on in Azure Mobile Services from a Windows Store application.

trans-unit.source: Authenticate your Windows Store app with client managed authentication using Microsoft account
trans-unit.target: Authenticate your Windows Store app with client managed authentication using Microsoft account

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from a Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from a Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using Live Connect.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using Live Connect.

trans-unit.source: When successfully authenticated by Live Connect, a logged-in user is welcomed by name and the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: When successfully authenticated by Live Connect, a logged-in user is welcomed by name and the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial demonstrates the benefits of using client-managed authentication and the Live SDK.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This tutorial demonstrates the benefits of using client-managed authentication and the Live SDK.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to more easily authenticate an already logged-on user with you mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to more easily authenticate an already logged-on user with you mobile service.

trans-unit.source: You can also request additional scopes to enable your app to also access resources like OneDrive.
trans-unit.target: You can also request additional scopes to enable your app to also access resources like OneDrive.

trans-unit.source: Service-managed authentication provides a more generalized experience and supports multiple authentication providers.
trans-unit.target: Service-managed authentication provides a more generalized experience and supports multiple authentication providers.

trans-unit.source: For more information about service-managed authentication, see the topic [Add authentication to your app](mobile-services-windows-store-javascript-get-started-users.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about service-managed authentication, see the topic [Add authentication to your app](mobile-services-windows-store-javascript-get-started-users.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]Ideally, you should not request either Live Connection authentiction tokens or Mobile Services authorization tokens every time that your app runs.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]Ideally, you should not request either Live Connection authentiction tokens or Mobile Services authorization tokens every time that your app runs.

trans-unit.source: Not only is this inefficient, you can run into usage-relates issues should many customers try to start your app at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Not only is this inefficient, you can run into usage-relates issues should many customers try to start your app at the same time.

trans-unit.source: A better approach is to cache the tokens and first try to use the cached Mobile Services token before calling **LoginWithMicrosoftAccountAsync**.
trans-unit.target: A better approach is to cache the tokens and first try to use the cached Mobile Services token before calling **LoginWithMicrosoftAccountAsync**.

trans-unit.source: For an example of how to cache this token, see [Get started with authentication](mobile-services-windows-store-javascript-get-started-users.md#tokens).
